description:
This is the market on the price of candlestick closing price (“C”) of Bitcoin on the resolution time, January 11 2022, 12:00 PM ET.

This market will resolve to the target price ($42,069 or $69,420) which will be "closer" to the actual Bitcoin price C on the resolution time. 

If the absolute difference between C and $42,069 is smaller than the absolute difference between C and $69,420, this market will resolve to "$42,069". 

If the absolute difference between C and $42,069 is larger than the absolute difference between C and $69,420, this market will resolve to "$69,420". 

If the Bitcoin price on the resolution time is exactly $55,744.50, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/bitcoin). 

This market will resolve based on the “C” (i.e. closing price) listed for the candle titled “Tue 11 January 2022, 12:00:00”, with the “Price” tab selected, in the Eastern Time Zone. Note, this 12:00:00 candle lists the opening price for 11:30:00 PM ET and the closing price for 12:00:00 PM ET.

markets.question: Will Bitcoin (BTC) price be closer to $42,069 or $69,420 at noon on January 11?

title: Will Bitcoin (BTC) price be closer to $42,069 or $69,420 at noon on January 11?
